noun.description: A person who directs the performance of an orchestra or choir.
examples: he was appointed principal conductor of the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra

noun.description: A person in charge of a train, streetcar, or other public conveyance, who collects fares and sells tickets.
A material or device that conducts or transmits heat, electricity, or sound, especially when regarded in terms of its capacity to do this.
examples: graphite is a reasonably good conductor of electricity

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a military leader): via Old French from Latin conductor, from conducere bring together (see conduct).
